level.heading: Definitions.
level.text: For the purposes of this chapter, the term:
“Director” means the Director of the District Department of the Environment.
“Dwelling unit” means a building or structure used or designed to be used, in whole or in part, as a living or sleeping place for one or more persons.
“Indoor mold assessment professional” means an indoor mold assessor certified and licensed by the District in accordance with § 8-241.03.

“Indoor mold” means living or dead fungi or related products or parts, including spores hyphae, and mycotoxins, on an interior surface of a building, including common spaces, utility spaces, HVAC, or other systems.
“Indoor mold contamination” means indoor mold at or above the threshold established under § 8-241.02(a)(1).
“Indoor mold remediation professional” means an indoor mold remediator certified and licensed by the District in accordance with § 8-241.03.
“Professional indoor mold assessment” means an indoor mold assessment conducted by an indoor mold assessment professional.
“Professional indoor mold remediation” means an indoor mold remediation conducted by an indoor mold remediation professional.

level.heading: Legislative history of Law 20-135
level.text: Law 20-135, the “Air Quality Amendment Act of 2013,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 20-368. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on May 6, 2014, and June 3, 2014, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on June 23, 2014, it was assigned Act No. 20-365 and transmitted to Congress for its review. D.C. Law 20-135 became effective on Sep. 9, 2014.
